result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean Chaney

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sean Chaney appeared by video.  Attorney Imran Kurter appeared by video for Sean Chaney.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and Filed: Order Appointing Counsel at County Expense

Defendant Sean Chaney appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for indigency hearing.  Defendant appears in Court without counsel.  Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation. Defendant requests court appointed counsel at the county rate. Court appoints Attorney Imran Kurter who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court orders defendant to repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning upon completion of the case and every month thereafter until paid in full.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Indigency hearing on October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of hearing was not mailed to the defendant.  Court rescheduled indigency hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Indigency hearing on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sean Chaney not in court.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for indigency hearing.  Defendant does not appear.  Court rescheduled matter to be held in person.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Indigency hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Indigency hearing on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Indigency hearing on September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sean Chaney in court by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is not eligible for SPD appointment of counsel and appears without counsel.  Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Sean Chaney in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-5-2022 @1p
